news_header: Greece declares a state of emergency on Santorini due to ongoing seismic activity.
news_original_title: Santorini: State of emergency declared as tremors continue
news_text: Authorities in Greece have declared a state of emergency on the island of Santorini as persistent tremors raise fears of a larger earthquake. Since January 26, the region has experienced thousands of tremors and over a hundred earthquakes, prompting the Greek Civil Protection Ministry to mobilize heavy equipment and emergency personnel. The declaration will be effective from February 1 to March 3. More than 11,000 people have evacuated the island, with reports indicating that around two-thirds of its inhabitants have left. The Athens Geodynamic Institute has recorded 110 earthquakes between magnitudes 4.0 and 4.9, with the strongest at 5.2. Experts warn that the seismic activity may continue for days or weeks.
